Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Autologous Bone Marrow Aspirate Concentrate and Platelet-Rich Plasma in Tibial Lengthening

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either BMAC plus PRP injection at the osteotomy site (treatment group, n=10) or no injection (control group, n=10).

Participants.evidence: 22 patients (44 tibias) undergoing bilateral tibial lengthening for familial short stature using the lengthening over nail technique.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either BMAC plus PRP injection at the osteotomy site (treatment group, n=10) or no injection (control group, n=10).

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy of autologous bone marrow aspirate concentrate (BMAC) combined with platelet-rich plasma (PRP) in enhancing osteogenesis.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the cortical healing index, assessed over a minimum follow-up of 24 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: The surgeon assessing radiographic healing was blinded to group allocation.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 22 patients (44 tibias) undergoing bilateral tibial lengthening

Number_Analysed.evidence: Two patients were excluded, leaving 20 patients (40 segments) for analysis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The treatment group showed significantly faster cortical healing indexes (anterior/posterior/medial/lateral: 1.14/0.81/0.96/0.88 months/cm) compared to the control group (1.47/1.26/1.42/1.22 months/cm; all p<0.001).
